abstract.text: Tells the delegate that a contextual menu interaction began.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The web view in which the interaction occurred.
An object that contains information about the element involved in the interaction.
The completion handler for you to call with information about how you want to handle the interaction. This handler block has no return value and takes the following parameter:
object that contains the details of how you want to handle the interaction. Specify
for this parameter if you don’t want to show a contextual menu.
You can call this method from synchronous code using a completion handler, as shown on this page, or you can call it as an asynchronous method that has the following declaration:

code: optional func webView(_ webView: WKWebView, contextMenuConfigurationFor elementInfo: WKContextMenuElementInfo) async -> UIContextMenuConfiguration?

inlineContent.text: For information about concurrency and asynchronous code in Swift, see

abstract.text: Learn how functions and methods that take a completion handler are converted to Swift asynchronous functions.
An object containing the configuration details for the contextual menu.
Provide quick access to useful actions by adding context menus to your iOS app.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Adding context menus in your app

abstract.text: Integrate web content seamlessly into your app, and customize content interactions to meet your app’s needs.
An object that contains information about a link the user clicked in a webpage, and which you use to configure a context menu for that link.
The methods for presenting native user interface elements on behalf of a webpage.
Tells the delegate that a contextual menu interaction began.
Tells the delegate that the web view dismissed the contextual menu for the specified element.
Provides the delegate with the animator object that the web view uses to display the contextual menu.
Tells the delegate that the web view is about to present the contextual menu for the specified element.
An object that displays interactive web content, such as for an in-app browser.
An object containing the configuration details for the contextual menu.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
